content: I use this with two Astrophysics mounts that have RAPAS alignment scope and an Ioptron Sky Tracker Pro also with the built in alignment scope. Works great and can switch between different types of mounts/alignment scopes. Make sure you set with correct location data (E or W) and correct hemisphere. When you turn it on GPS has to be on for auto location so wait until the GPS satellites are located or you will have wrong alignment point. You will know when it connects when the coordinates display.

Very slow to get GPS coordinates, other apps don't have the same problem. Installed the update but does not appear to have made any difference. Waiting 20 mins now and it still hasn't got coordinates. I have checked that permissions are ok. Other apps like SAM console, GPS Essentials get location in seconds. I have rebooted phone etc. but still no joy. Finally after about 23 mins it got location details - very poor :-(
replyContent: Please check this new version. GPS update should now be much quicker.

content: At first it didnt work, after restarting my phone it works perfect now.

content: Why know where Polaris is? Polar alignment allows for precise tracking on an equatorial mount. This app supports the Astro-Physics RAPAS, and straight through polar scopes from several EQ mount makers. Saves a lot of time doing a drift alignment by getting you that much closer to the NCP if not directly right on. Compared to the PoleMaster, I'd stick with the Polar Finder app IF your pole scope is properly aligned and reliable.

I just installed this after reading the reviews and comparing it to other Android apps and it looks very promising. The only reason for only 4 stars is that the reticle for the Skywatcher EXOSII polar scope is not included. I hope to have some clear skies soon and would like to be able to use this app. Any ideas how I can? Can the reticle be added?
replyContent: Please contact me directly on my email and I will see what I can do for you.

content: can not get to preferences menu on A Galaxy note 8. a bit useless without any preference options. read instructions - it says use recent apps button. It brings up recent apps (surprise surprise!) l and not preferences
replyContent: On some OS versions the Preferences menu (small wrench icon in the title bar) does not appear at first start. Please turn the device to landscape and back to portrait a few times.Then exit and start the app again. That helps. Don't worry, this has to be done only once.

content: This app cost 3 lost nights of bad astrophotography results, totalling 6 hours of standing in the cold. Most significantly, the app can be set to an iOptron reticle, which you will only ever see in a telescope, but still also be set to "naked eye" orientation, which will give you 180 degrees of error in the result. The app should show a warning to prevent this kind of mistake. Also, it presents a dead wrong result as correct for several seconds before GPS kicks in. Very careless design.
replyContent: There are others with naked eye versions so the app can't see what you or others have! I would not rate something as "careless design", just because it supports more different types.

content:
I checked many other apps , and this is the best one. I like inclusion of 
ioptron style view.

There is a bug whereby when first started it does nothing, no input whatsoever was allowed, no upper menu. Upon restarting and ever since the app has worked OK. Have not found any of the issues other uses have reported: guess they have all been fixed. A minor issue is that, although the Big Dipper and Cassiopea are shown, the Little Dipper (which ends in Polaris) is not.  Unfortunately, an issue subsists that makes the whole app useless. Polaris is simply not in its correct place, but a very significant 3mm off. For example, if in Preferences I select for "Reticle type" Skywatcher, Polaris lies in a 3.5mm circle around the North Pole true direction (central dot). It should be less than 1mm from it.   As a confirmation, I used two different astronomical programs (Stellarium and Starry Night): I went to the Big Dipper, and imagined a straight line from the penultimate star of the dipper (Merak) to the last star (Dubhe) and continued towads Polaris: the line misses Polaris, crossing the Little Dipper a little bit counterclockwise, between Polaris and Delta Ursa Minor.  In Polar Finder Polaris is not there but on the other side of the straight line! Useless.
replyContent: Please pick up direct contact with me via email where we can discuss all your questions.

content: Once I took the time to go through the Tools set-up (use GPS time, etc.), it worked beautifully using the built-in reticle display. I really like having the choice of views (Telescopic, Naked, eye, Diagonal). I was able to verify using SkySafari and TheSkyX. Excellent app.

Polar alignment made simple as can be.  If your trying to get a good polar alignment this app will help . Simple to use and works just fine. I have a Ioptron IEQ 45 mount. Ioptron made it somewhat easy to polar align. This app takes their work to the next level and makes it even easier to get it right.  All you do is look at the image it gives you for your polar scope. Set your mounts polar scope to look just like it and BAM. You have a really good polar alignment. This is a great simple app that works as intended. Own a equatorial mount ? This apps for you.

replyContent: The application "simulates" the movement (rotation) of the Earth and how the Polaris is making one turn around the North celestial Pole. So please don't await that it moves so fast that you can see it. One turn is 24 hours. Please pick up contact with me if you have more questions, and give 5 start if you like it. Thanks.

content: Additional help via email was speedy and relevant. I'm stuck in one of those countries that is part of the uk but not according to Google. If you have the same problems, get droid vpn and set it up to connect to Holland. Go to the store and select buy, when it asks for payment or says password is incorrect close the vpn and keep trying. You might need to log into Google to confirm the log ins were you.  Great app and fantastic support

Position matches now, selected the wrong settings. Any chance to include the PA in all rectile types, not only iOptron? Edit: developer reacts very fast by email, helpful and implements asked features. Worth the price
